intro: Aporosa rhacostyla, commonly known as the red-flowered evergreen, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of bright red flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for indoor gardening and landscape design.
